title.narrative: Mechanism 13583 - ICAP

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The ICAP-TA project supports goals and objectives of the PEPFAR BLUEPRINT’S ROAD MAP to: Saving Lives, Smart Investments, Shared Responsibility and Driving Results with Science; PF GOALS: 1) Scale up CT, PMTCT and ART; 2) Community mobilization and linkages 3) Increase Provincial and District Health capacity; 4) Quality assurance and quality improvement activities; HIV ACCELERATION PLAN GOALS t Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.15: Biomedical Prevention - Medical Male Circumcision. Policy, training, outreach, message development, service delivery, quality assurance, and equipment and commodities related to male circumcision (MC). Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.4: Biomedical Prevention - Injection Safety. Policies, training, waste-management systems, advocacy and other activities to promote medical injection safety, including distribution/supply chain, cost and appropriate disposal of injection equipment and other related equipment and supplies. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

The ICAP-TA project supports goals and objectives of the PEPFAR BLUEPRINT’S ROAD MAP to: Saving Lives, Smart Investments, Shared Responsibility and Driving Results with Science; PF GOALS: 1) Scale up CT, PMTCT and ART; 2) Community mobilization and linkages 3) Increase Provincial and District Health capacity; 4) Quality assurance and quality improvement activities; HIV ACCELERATION PLAN GOALS to 1) Increase the percent of eligible adults and children receiving ART to 80% 2) Reduce the number of new HIV infections by 50% and 3) Reduce the rate of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV to 5% by 2015; and supports GHI GOALS to: Expand access and uptake of quality MNCH services and Strengthen Governance in the Health Sector.
ICAP TA works in Nampula province operating in 21 districts including in Nampula City and the districts of Ilha de Mozambique and Nacala Porto. Activities will target the general population, PLHIV, including children and pregnant women.
Strategies for this mechanism to become more cost efficient over time include routinely tracking and reporting on expenditure data by program area with a view of reducing expenditures each year. The other strategy is by building provincial and district health finance and administrative management capacity in order to transition these functions to them.
The M&E plan includes routine, systematic collection and analysis of data on 1) the quantity, quality and impact of HIV clinical services, 2) systems strengthening and financial accountability and 3) administrative management strengthening activities which are routinely measured by partners’ M&E staff at health facility, district, province and country and Headquarters level.
This partner also receives GBVI funds to implement the MOH minimum package of services

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
